Administration Assistant

Company Name carsales.com.au Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 180 views

Job description

  • ASX top 100 with the heart of a start up
  • Passionate about supporting a diverse & inclusive workplace culture
  • Work for Forbes' #12 most innovative growth company in the world

Got drive? You’ll fit right in.

In 1997 we tried something new - we've been doing it ever since. From humble start-up beginnings, today we're an ASX top 100 with world-class technology and advertising solutions. Not only are we the largest online automotive, motorcycle and marine classifieds business in Australia, we're growing across Latin America and Asia.

The role

We’re on the lookout for an enthusiastic and motivated individual to support our Client Contact Centre team and work closely with our dealer clients. You’ll be the go-to person helping out with a wide range of admin related tasks and duties, ensuring that they’re completed within required timeframes.

What You’ll Do
  • Assist and work closely with our management team to provide ongoing administrative support.
  • Format documents and spreadsheets so they are suitable for printing or presentations.
  • Work with our dealer clients and assist them with moving stock, as well as any ad-hoc additional issues or enquiries that they may have.
  • Monitor and resolve any issues that are reported through the carsales site and ensure that all users are compliant with the carsales terms.
  • Work closely with the Client Contact Centre to ensure our customer service is fluid and transparent.


What We’re Looking For
  • A highly motivated team player who’s all about providing exceptional customer service experiences.
  • Someone who’s confident when it comes to fostering relationships and building rapport.
  • A self-starter multitasker who can effectively juggle multiple tasks and priorities without dropping the ball.
  • An articulate communicator with a clear speaking voice and impeccable written skills.
  • Someone who is comfortable reading and interpreting data and making decisions based on what the data says.
  • A tech savvy mindset – you pick up new systems quickly and are a whiz with Excel.


Why Apply?

carsales offers extensive opportunities to learn and evolve in a diverse, fast-paced and dynamic environment. We are committed to our people through many ongoing initiatives associated with culture and benefits, career development, health and well-being, community, work-life balance, reward and recognition. We continually strive to attract and retain the most talented people through a number of programs designed to support learning and development. When you work at carsales you don't just have a job, but you have a rewarding career.

carsales is an equal opportunity employer who prides themselves on providing a diverse workplace that brings out the best in its people. We encourage women and men of all ages and background to apply.



  • And just a quick one…
    Successful candidates joining the carsales family are required to undergo a National Police Record check and must have full-time Australian working rights on an ongoing basis.

Inside Sales Representative

Company Name Esko Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 21 hours ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Main role / Job Objective

You will focus on selling small value Esko software products and services (Maintenance Contracts & Software Support Contracts) over the phone to prospective & existing customers within your designated geography. Your main focus lies in the establishment of excellent client relationships and the ability to continuously build up the sales funnel and engage these customers, with the ultimate objective of closing sales.

Main Responsibilities And Key Activities
  • Contact a pre-defined selection of qualified leads and prospects to effectively promote the concept of Software / Hardware Support Contracts to existing & prospective customers. These contacts may come from outbound campaigns, inbound leads, web leads and information requests
  • Identify decision makers within the target companies in order to start the sales process and enthuse customers with effective solutions to meet customer needs
  • Manage accounts by closely following through by means of commercial arguments and obtaining successful closure of the order
  • Achieve monthly defined targets and objectives through a disciplined approach in working through the pipeline & working closely with the team to secure orders
  • Demonstrate an ability to develop and maintain a strong working relationship with prospects, customers & internal sales/service/marketing teams
  • Maintain prospect database including pipeline and forecast information
  • Closely monitor and report on continuous improvement progress of leads and prospects on a weekly, monthly, quarterly and yearly basis. Escalate critical issues to reporting manager to close gaps
  • Maximize the opportunity during each call and escalate larger value projects to the field Sales teams to follow-up on
Qualifications And Professional Knowledge
  • Minimum Diploma/Degree in any relevant discipline (Graphics, Engineering, Biz Studies)
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in sales or inside sales within a B2B environment, preferably in the printing or packaging industry. You would have a track record of meeting & exceeding sales targets
  • Experience in Inside sales, preferably in selling Maintenance Contracts, Software Support Contracts, or small value Software is a definite plus
  • Good knowledge of MS Office
  • Language skills English
  • Excellent telephone sales personality skills and must be very comfortable enthusing & selling via the phone
Competencies
  • High energy with enthusiasm to sell & meet targets
  • Comfortable in engaging and talking to customers over the phone
  • Positive/optimistic outlook
  • Must be a team player with a positive and can-do work attitude
Esko is the worldwide market leader with software for packaging buyers, designers and manufacturers and hardware products for the packaging, label, sign and display industries. With Headquarters in Gent - Belgium, Esko employs around 1,200 people worldwide. Its global sales and support organization covers Europe, the Americas, Asia/Pacific and Japan.

Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, dental, environmental and applied solutions. Our globally diverse team of 67,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $18.3B in revenue last year. We are ranked #162 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P 500 by more than 1,200% over 20 years.

At Danaher, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. We’re innovative, fast-paced, results-oriented, and we win. We need talented people to keep winning. Here you’ll learn how DBS is used to shape strategy, focus execution, align our people, and create value for customers and shareholders.

Come join our winning team!

About The Company

We provide Victorians with financial and legal assistance during all stages of their life, including specialised services and products such as Will Writing, Powers of Attorney, Executor Services, Trustee Services, and Personal Financial Administration.

For more information about how State Trustees assists Victorians please visit our website www.statetrustees.com.au

About The Role

This is a hands-on, technical role where you will provision, install/configure, operate and maintain systems hardware and software and related infrastructure.

You will be accountable for the management and development of the storage, networking and computer systems that support State Trustees Windows and Linux infrastructure. You will also lead technical research and development to enable continued innovation within the team.

Skills And Experience
  • Tertiary qualification in IT or business related discipline or equivalent work experience
  • System administrator experience in a financial or Government institution.
  • Experience with virtualisation technologies (e.g. VMWare, Hyper-V)
  • Experience with implementing, maintaining and supporting a virtualised Microsoft Server 2012 or newer, inclusive of Active Directory management
  • Windows 10 and Office 2016 SOE development and management skills.
  • Working in a secure networked environment.
  • Experience with software application packaging and distribution (e.g. AppV, SCCM, WSUS/WDS)
  • Experience with Remote Access technologies (e.g. Citrix)
  • Managing security gateways and controls, i.e. Firewalls/IPS, email and web protection systems
  • Managing a collapsed core network, including storage and compute technologies.
  • ITIL Service Management Foundation Certification
  • Excellent communication and customer service skills

  • Employee assistance program
  • Reward and recognition program

  • Employee social club

How to Apply
Click the Apply button to commence the application process. In your application, please include a cover letter and resume.

Employment at State Trustees is conditional upon satisfactory Criminal History Check and Anti Money Laundering Check.

Principal Architect - BI/Analytics

Company Name CGI Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

CGI is looking for an experienced Principal Architect (BI/Analytics) to join our growing team of Business Intelligence and Data Analytics experts. You will work with our Melbourne and Hobart based clients to drive growth across CGI’s Analytics Digital Technology Practice.


The Principal Architect will be responsible for providing high value chargeable strategic and architectural services to clients leading the development of industry specific systems mostly aligned to projects, consulting assignments, building and installing turnkey business solutions. You will also provide advice and guidance to CGI and client stakeholders.


We are looking for a BI Specialist who is passionate about data and client success, loves to share knowledge and wants to work as part of a global community of experts, bringing CGI success stories to Australia and sharing Australian achievements with our other global offices.


YOUR FUTURE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES\xa0:

  • Designing and developing high quality business solutions and other projects
  • Evaluating clients' business needs, thus contributing to strategic planning of information systems facilities, resource requirements and software directions
  • Being accountable for defined work assignments often involving immediate action or short term planning of human and other resources
  • Planning and coordinating resources necessary to complete product implementation and assisting in preparation of major sales proposals
  • Liaising with major customers during preliminary installation and testing of developed solutions or products
  • Managing a team of consultants (largely dependent on the size and scope of the client project)
  • Investigates future business opportunities relating to Business Intelligence
  • Considered a leader in emerging technologies. Recognise and share the opportunities new technologies bring to both CGI and client
  • Influences senior stakeholders within clients through BI Consulting skills, client/domain knowledge and vision and objective. Collaborate with senior stakeholders to secure funding for new initiatives
  • Lead discovery and analysis of requirements for BI related projects

\xa0

As a Consultant at CGI you will be flexible in working with different clients and performing various roles. The duties described detail the first assignment in your career at CGI.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE:

  • 10-15 years of experience in business management, IT, systems integration consulting, design.
  • 10+ years experience in consulting
  • Preferred engagement/project management, and/or business and resource management experience
  • Specialist knowledge of many industries or segments (Health and Government experience will be highly regarded) coupled with strong analytical skills
  • Preferred experience using Microsoft BI Stack
  • Recognised as leading expert in specialty area
  • Can adapt and apply existing techniques and methodologies to new uses
  • Ability to present technical and non-technical information to small and large groups, including senior management levels within client and CGI
  • Have a wide understanding and demonstrate hands on experience in design and implementation of a wide range of industry solutions relating to BI
  • Build peer client relationship through personal credibility and successful on-time and on-budget delivery
  • Strategic mindset


This is a great opportunity to join a winning team. CGI offers a competitive compensation package with opportunities for growth and professional development.

\xa0

We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying for this position, however, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted.

\xa0

A criminal record check will be conducted for successful applicants. CGI does not discourage applicants with a criminal record from applying.

[

Channel Systems Engineer, Melbourne

Company Name Palo Alto Networks Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 48 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Description

As a Palo Alto Networks' Channel Systems Engineer (ChSE), you will be responsible for presenting the Palo Alto Networks Next Generation security platform & technology solutions to Palo Alto Networks’ most strategic and impactful channel partners. As a field based Channel SE, you will be tasked with delivering training, best practices and demonstrations of PANW products in person and remotely. You will be accountable for gathering the partner’s technical requirements for new features and knowledge.

As an extended member of the Sales and Channels team, the Channel SE will align with the PANW Sales teams and Channel Account Managers in the region to create update and deliver the partner technical enablement strategy. The impact of this person will be tracked and used as one key variable in how they get compensated.

Responsibilities


  • Build relationships with key partner and PANW SE’s within their resident geography and assigned partner base
  • Focus on enablement & relationships for limited number of partners & new recruits
  • Management and creation of technical enablement plan for channel partners
  • Owns, monitors, reports on, and drives technical enablement activities for assigned partner base
  • Teaches in-geo SEs and Value Added Distributor how to manage and deliver technical enablement plan for their partner base
  • Be a PANW technical expert: know networking, security, competition and channels business dynamics
  • Can walk the talk: lead lab, demo, best practices session & workshops
  • Provide on the job training for partner SE’s by allowing partner SE’s to shadow presentations and evaluation installations.
  • Coordinate partner training activities with wide range of PANW field & corporate resources
  • Host CNSE study groups to provide tutoring opportunities for partner SEs
  • Provide ad-hoc support for evaluations and post sales issues with partner engineers, and quickly transition them to appropriate internal resources
  • Present at channel driven marketing activities on an as needed basis.
  • Assist in the selling effort to partner technical resources during new partner recruitment
  • Collaborates with other Channel SEs and in-geo SEs & AMs, trainers

Qualifications
  • Experience designing, selling, demonstrating, installing and troubleshooting network infrastructure and security products.
  • Experience that emphasizes L2-L4 Networking (L2 Switching architectures including Spanning Tree, IP routing including OSPF and BGP ,L4 Load balancing )
  • Ability to work independently while following prescribed enablement plan BSCS or equivalent and 3+ years of experience as an SE preferably in a partner facing role.
  • Travel of approximately 50% within resident/home region.

Other Qualifications


  • Self-motivated, high-energy and fun spirited individual who takes a very friendly and helping-hand approach
  • Strong communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills, both internally and externally. Can passionately deliver high-level messaging & most TOI sessions.
  • Strong problem finding and solving skills, ability to analyze complex problems and use a systematic approach to gain quick resolution, even under duress
  • Superior organizational skills
  • 'Whatever it takes' attitude and motivation to do whatever necessary to assist in closing a deal

Preferences
  • Highly preferred: Technical Channel SE experience working with assigned partners and understanding of a channel centric go to market approach.
  • Experience working on Palo Alto Networks products (ACE and CNSE certs)
  • Experience from companies in the enterprise networking security space.
  • Experience installing and configuring a virtual environments
  • Experience understanding threat signatures and their creation

Industry

  • Computer & Network Security

Full-time

  • Quality Assurance
  • Product Management
  • Engineering
